author: @nspecthy
text: I remember the day You Make My Day was released like it was yesterday. But it's been 5 years now and I can't even believe it really. Everything in my life has changed now but one thing that never changed is my love for you, my Seventeen, and the emotional attachment to this song specifically. I listen to it every summer and each time I feel like crying. You truly made me who I am today, my boys, and I couldn't be more thankful for that. May the future bring us more and more years together, because I need you more than anything.

text: I'm so happy to genuinely love this group, not only cuz they are funny and cool and visual etc but they are such good musicians and performers! Never heard a svt song I didn't like. I liked other groups at first but many times I would force myself to like their songs as being a part of their Fandom, but w svt I'm so happy that I genuinely enjoy their music along with their crackheadedness that I feel I've found my ppl. I started becoming their fan at a hard time in my life and although I regret I found them so late, I'm glad atleast I did. Thank you svtâ™¡

author: @fishfilet471
text:
*How was the Enlightenment related to the Scientific Revolution- The Enlightenment allied the idea of natural laws to human affairs rather than the physical universe
*Which eighteenth-century Muslim religious leader emphasized women's rights to control their dowries, divorce, and engage in commerce- Al-Wahhab
*Which of the following statements best describes Martin Luther's teachings-  Humans can be saved by faith in God alone, and the source of all religious authority is the Bible
*Which of the following reflects the Enlightenment view of the innate qualities of the individual- Thoughtful, rational, and independent  
*In what way did the nineteenth-century developments in the sciences depart from Enlightenment principles- They emphasized conflict and struggle as the motors
*Catholic Church authorities forced this early astronomer to publicly renounce his thesis that the earth moves around the sun- Galileo Galilei 
*Which tradition in early moden China shared with some Chinese Buddhists the idea that normal people can improve themselves through introspection, while still living in the everyday world- Thought of Wang Yangming 
*Wang Yangming in his view of Confucianism- Argued that individuals could find their own path to virtue and salvation
*Which of the following marked a major turning point in the relationship between China and Christian missionaries-  The popes claim of authority over Chinese Christians
*What facilitated the spread of the Protestant reformation in Europe- The Printing Press
*Which nineteenth century historian and political scientist argued that conflicting social classes drove the process of human history- Karl Marx
*Which of the following is an example of how Mughal India handled religious differences in EMA- Akbar formulated a state cult that combined elements of Islam, Hinduism, Zoroastrianism
*Scholars have identified which of the following as a key factor that contributed to the Scientific revolution in Europe- Theology 
*What factors made some parts of the world more receptive to Christianity than others- The absence of a literate world religion
*Which of the following is a principle or practice upheld in Sikhism- Equality of men and women
*Which of the following were the most intent on converting native peoples to their religion- Catholics

text:
who's here to watch this choreography video on their 7th anniv? 

thank you so much SVT, for being there since college, your music and variety shows are my companions during exam weeks when I thought I can't make it, you were the one who calms me down when I am cramming with my major subjects while dealing with my daily OJT life. thank you for reminding me to stay here with you (from their song Kidult) when I almost end everything on my own terms. thank you for being my escape away when reality seems so chaotic. 

Happy 7th my love, here's to more more more "say the name" with you!

author: @itsnotmeitsyou7394
text:
I saw a comment here some time ago asking why do Seventeen songs sound nostalgic even if it's their first time listening to it. 

Personally, I think it's because Seventeen's concept heavily relies on youth and growing up. They explicitly explore all phases of your youth from early adolescence until present day. They specifically lean into experiences of love - from having a crush to experiencing puppy love until it blooms to a mature one, even dealing with the toxicity and problems of relationships, which I think all of us had experienced once or twice. To make it better, Seventeen (most especially Woozi) knows how to capture the sound of innocence or torment or trauma in a song. You listen to a certain song and you'll definitely know what kind of emotion they're singing even without looking up the lyrics. 

What also adds to the nostalgic feeling is that Seventeen refuses to follow what's trendy but stick to what message they want to convey - which most likely be their hurdles, their thoughts during that particular phase in their life. Their songs are like journal entries of them growing up and we're blessed to be able to experience them through their songs.

EDIT: if any of you are interested in reading more svt stuff like this, i just started a blog at tumblr. it's basically just a compilation of stuff  like this  but much more elaborated and probably with pretty pictures haha Im kishirina there! let's meet and be friends pls

OKAY hear me out. Last night was the first time i watched a svt song mv; don't wanna cry. text:
back when i just started stanning them, i remember having an anxiety attack (triggered by some personal problems), i coudn't breathe well. i tried to relax and calm myself down while i keep watching this video over and over until my breathing came back to normal. idkw but there is just smthng in this song that calms me: their voices, the rhythm, the song itself, their dance, and just everything. And that was the exact moment when i realize that they are really my home and comfort. â™¡ 
and now whnvr i am having anxiety, getting stressed out, or simply having a bad day, this song, or this video in general, never disappoints to comfort me.

author: @snehasar3854
text:
I was reading a very sad story right now ... This song has always comforted me... I love Seventeen and will always do... I always wished to have brothers like you all in real life... But I guess even if I can't meet you everyday or talk to you but you still always brought a sense of happiness and comfort in my life... You always make my day the brightest... I feel the sincere message everytime I listen to your music... I love you my brothers... As a single girl child I sometimes feel the need for a big bro... When other people talk about their siblings, l just feel a little jealous... But now that I have you all, not just one but THIRTEEN BIG BROS... I can proudly say that I have 13 brothers and my CARAT FAMILY to always comfort me, make me laugh and sometimes even cry because of their sincere feelings...My 13 Diamond Brothers... I love you~ 
Thank you for helping me in my hard times... Seranghe~
 And for my Carat family...
Caranghe~


PS: Sorry for such a long comment...
Those who read the whole comment. Thank you for reading my feelings about Seventeen...

author: @Noonym_not
text:
I now finally get how people can think that there is a lot of members.

The thing is that whenever I find a new group, the first thing I do is I count the members. Just the other day I found a new group and I was like WOAH there are so many members but after I counted them there were just 9...and then I went WOAH...there are somehow 4 more members in Seventeen...

Anyways, take it from a carat, you may find it overhelming now but after you get to know them you wouldn't be able to imagine Seventeen without any of it's 13 members. Give it a chance and you may just as well find you've fallen in love with these 13 crackheads.

author: @aidaserzo1938
text:
Ive never thought that one day i will stan any kpop groups but when i heard one of their song that was played by my carat cousin  , I felt attached with it with no reasons , i dont know who are they , i dont know what is their group names , Ive never heard any thing about them compared to other known groups in our country. It all strated from one song that i played countless times. Whenever i watched any live shows of that song , i scroll down to the comments and their fans made me fell in love with them even more. Ever since that day I started to watched other songs made by SVT  and i hardly fell inlove more and more . I had realized that I came too late , and i should have know them earlier. There are still soooo many people who slept on SVT , and I dont know why, is it because there are too many ? Or is it because other groups are a lot more extra whenever they are in show and in front of camera and they seems so fake. 
I have chosen SVT not just because their songs were really really good but also because they show their real selves , you can see how their expressions were genuine and true. How precious they are when they smile and laugh.  SVT were also very lucky because of their fans . 

I am thanking Seventeen as well as my fellow carats. Thank you for getting me slipped to the diamond life. I would never ever regret it. Svt has become a big part of my life , they are the one who makes  me smile whenever im sad and they make me even happier when im in a good mood. Their awards and success was also my success. I just wish they know how much im proud of them .

author: @LifeWithLeSanti
text: My favorite group of all time. My Ultimate Fav Kpop group. I am such a BIG(HUGE) Multistan and as of rn I stan more than 250 groups....almost at 300....and Seventeen is my absolute #1. I love them so much.....thinking about all the hardships I've encountered while growing up... I was going through such a rough time when they dropped this back in 2018...I cry listening to it now... every time... I was on the verge of giving up everything...and Seventeen reminded me why I can't give up. I love them so much with all my heart. CAN'T WAIT UNTIL MY NEXT CONCERT WITH THEMMMMMM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! SO EXCITED

text: Iâ€™m kind of new to seventeen... but who is the guy in full white? I know he stands out because heâ€™s wearing full white but Iâ€™m asking about him cause I can see he is an exceptional dancer! His movements are very clean, open, and wide. I love it. I even replayed 20 times to look at all the members dancing at the chorus but I couldnâ€™t find one compared to him. At 3:01 I admired him even more because he put his head down and no other member did when they dropped. It made his movement way more emphasized and eye catching. 1:03, he literally rocks his body and makes sure you can see it clearly! Also, whoâ€™s the one at 2:05, same thing goes for him too! I can tell he dances very well!

Also, woozi is a fucking genius. All of them are, actually.

This is not to gain likes or anything. I just want to write this.
I was feeling upset the last two hours. Nothing or no one could cheer me up. I heard this song somewhere before and wanted to listen to it later. But I found this on my recommendation. And this has given me so much peace. I'm thankful for all 13 of them. They helped me forget what happened. I feel so peaceful now. I'll always remember what they did to meâ¤ Thank you SEVENTEEN. May God bless you all so much

author: @msmsmsms1
text:
I know this might be late but I just wanted to share you guys something. This song was played and covered by the members of the dance troop in our school. They used this as their intermission number of an event in our school. Most of the students in our school donâ€™t really recognize this song by seventeen because itâ€™s a side track and only few knew seventeen yet most of us(yes, including me) gets emotional, nostalgic, or whatsoever. It was aesthetic to look at especially they performed it at night with matching lights. Even itâ€™s just a cover, all of us admit it that it was so beautiful. Even the teachers and staff in our school said so. Even the non-kpop fans, some asked me who sang that. Even the bashers(some), they said that itâ€™s different from other kpop songs. To me, this song is for everyone, not just carats. I never knew that this would also affect to a non-fan or even a basher. This song is reallyâ€” I canâ€™t explain in words because there are no enough words to use to describe this masterpiece ğŸ˜­ğŸ’

I almost forgot, my homeroom teacher also complimented them(seventeen) I forgot the exact words but itâ€™s still the same 

â€œWho were the boys dancing to this? I dislike kpop but this might change my mind. Why this sounds so different from other kpop songs? The dance, too, is magnificent. Itâ€™s my first time listening to this but why I remembered the time I was young with my family staying on a beach house for a night. They are amazing, they can make people nostalgic. Hahaâ€ 

I forgot few of what my teacher said but to me, I couldnâ€™t help but to be proud of seventeen because they literally conveyed and interpreted it well ğŸ˜­

text: For me, this video is breathtakingly beautiful. Just look at the light effects, the settings, and even their clothes. Itâ€™s too aesthetic that makes me a sobbing mess. This choreography they made, I donâ€™t know how to explain but I donâ€™t know any words to describe this kind of masterpiece. Most people are more on sharp and complex choreography but a choreography like this, which is graceful and elegant, is just on another level. I know we are amazed from other choreographies because they are sharp or complex but choreography like this is just so unique. Itâ€™s like telling you a story visually. If you translated this song in english, it shows that seventeen interpreted it mesmerizingly. Just by watching this video, itâ€™s just so aesthetic and pleasing. Itâ€™s breathtaking. Choreography like this deserves more attention. I am really proud of seventeen for creating such a masterpiece ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ’

author: @nightskies_9198
text:
0:07 I LOVE YOU JOSHUAAA <3
0:25 omg I love that part when they open and close their hands. idk why--but it just looks cool. :')
0:32 Don't Wanna Cry feels. T.T the reason it gives me feels is because DWC was the first song I've heard by them and how I became a Carat so that move is just like yesss.
0:38 this is my 4347583949x listening/watching this song and Wonwoo's part just gives me chills every time. heart eyes
1:34 look at rapper line go!! :')
1:59 cries
2:01 cries even more when the rest of the members pop out
2:44 I love this :')
3:07 i'm crying at how Seungkwan's expression went from laughing to serious in less than a second while S.Coups was still laughing the whole time lmao xD
3:22 this outro is everything where the right, left, and middle sides took turns waving bye to us, Carats. T.T <3

one thing I learned from this video: dance line who?? seems to me all thirteen of them should be in dance line instead of just four. they're honestly always in sync and never fails to amaze me. :))

thank you, Hoshi, for always creating such beautiful choreographies & thank you, Woozi, for always writing beautiful lyrics (I know Woozi wasn't the only one who wrote the lyrics for this song but i'm just saying in general, those two usually does those stuff). <3

author: @nayu7267
text: The thing that is so captivating about Seventeen's choreographies is that even though they have way more than the standard number of members, they take advantage of the size of their group and make every single unit's movements count in their choreography. The flow of the place changes and small nuances in each member's movements altogether complete a fluid unit of movement that completes a picture that would look different if even one member were taken out. I can't think of any other kpop group that incorporates member placements and and group movement like Seventeen does.

author: @shikiynah07
text: Those people who disliked this video must not know what 'class' and 'elegance' is. Only people who can recognize true art and music combined will appreciate these kind of work. They are both good in musicality and artistry, they know their aesthetics, and they know exactly what goes well with what. Not only in this specific video but since day 1 of their debut (or even before their debut), all of their songs, music videos, choreography, and story. They are not trying to compete or surpass anybody but themselves. Pure bloods.

author: @fantasty9311
text: Choreography like this is so underrated! Often times, I see a lot of dances that are sharp, fast and powerful from groups and it often easily catch viewer's attention and that's what I've always feel as to be the most entertaining and it still is. However, I've seem to neglect that dances like this, gentle, subtle, and graceful contains beauty of its own too. So much attention to detail and so much precision must be directed accordingly to give the correct feeling and message across to viewers, and that is exactly what Seventeen did here. It's this kind of dance that are so unforgettable and so memorable.

author: @kristofferloistantano7801
text:
Okay hold up y'all this gonna be long. 

For a long time I've always wondered why no one can ever top Seventeen's dancing for me. There are a looot of artists in the kpop scene that are really good at dancing, but for some reason, for me, Seventeen stands on another level. So I thought about it, and the most accurate reason I could come up with is because Seventeen delivers art. No, I'm not saying it in a simple way, I'm saying Seventeen focuses and incorporates art on their dancing (from the formations to the transitions, from the precision of each step to the details of each minute movement, from both complexity and simpleness to the overall synchronization) - everything is on point. Seventeen dances gracefully. There is something in the way they move individually and as a group that is unlike any other. I can only explain this by saying that they have this aura of gentleness, even when they perform strong and powerful dances. I've noticed this ever since I saw their performance of Yuhaengga, where I realized the beauty in dancing slow songs, even if most of the movements are just walking.

I was once told of an experience when a fellow carat was watching a performance of Without You, and someone they know joined in watching the video and commented that it's not that good because SVT isn't energetic. I was about to lash at that story but I realized there was no point, because people have different tastes. See, what I've noticed on comments on many choreography videos, specially on boy group dances, is that most people equate power and the strength of dance moves to its awesomeness and difficulty. If it's fast, it's awesome. If there's a lot of movements, it's hard.  I love Without You's choreography very much, I can say that it's one of Seventeen's masterpieces. And here I would like to stress that slow movements comprised with gentle gestures and synchronized walking is just as powerful as strong, hiphop, or sexy choreos. 

And with the addition of Our Dawn Is Hotter Than Day, I cannot stress any stronger how creative Seventeen, most especially Hoshi and the rest of Performance Team really are. I love this choreo very much, from the movements during "Oh oh, Oh oh" to the way they showed farewell at the end. And the "Oh Summer Summer Summer Summer" part leaves me dazed. Whenever Seventeen performs, it is this gentleness that makes them stand out the most to me. Even in their powerful dances, especially Chuck, I can still see this sort of gentlemanliness in the way they carry the choreography. It makes me proud that they really carry their "Kingsman" vibe in every performance, and not just in No F.U.N., because that's how I see Seventeen: Kingsmen on their way to kill you with elegance through their performances. The way I see it, Seventeen focuses on the art itself, and not on the effect of art, when they dance.

Thank you SVT, for making positive songs and full of energy.
